meanings.definition: To serve as a co-captain with another person.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys cocaptaining the team with her best friend.
meanings.sent2: They are cocaptaining the ship on their journey across the ocean.
meanings.sent3: Cocaptaining the school project made the workload feel lighter.
meanings.sent4: The siblings cocaptained the family vacation, ensuring everyone had a great time.
meanings.sent5: Cocaptaining the soccer team requires good communication and teamwork.

meanings.definition: The act of sharing the responsibilities of being a captain with someone else.
meanings.sent1: Cocaptaining allows for a supportive leadership dynamic.
meanings.sent2: The success of the team is attributed to their effective cocaptaining.
meanings.sent3: The twins' cocaptaining of the club event led to a fun and organized day.
meanings.sent4: Their cocaptaining of the project was like a well-choreographed dance.
meanings.sent5: The cocaptaining of the group project resulted in a top-notch presentation.
